section:
Luthetus.TextEditor.RazorLib.CompilerServices.Syntax.Nodes.CodeBlockNode Class Reference Luthetus.TextEditor.RazorLib.CompilerServices.Syntax.Nodes.CodeBlockNode
The CodeBlockNode is used for storing a sequence of statements (or a single expression-statement). Perhaps one might use CodeBlockNode for the body of a class definition, for example.
Inheritance diagram for Luthetus.TextEditor.RazorLib.CompilerServices.Syntax.Nodes.CodeBlockNode:

Properties
ImmutableArray< TextEditorDiagnostic > DiagnosticsList [get]
bool IsFabricated [get]
IsFabricated refers to when the ParserSession expected a node to be valid, but it wasn't.For example, a function invocation on an undefined function will construct a BoundFunctionInvocationNode with IsFabricated set to true.
SyntaxKind SyntaxKind [get]
Detailed Description
The CodeBlockNode is used for storing a sequence of statements (or a single expression-statement). Perhaps one might use CodeBlockNode for the body of a class definition, for example.

bool Luthetus.TextEditor.RazorLib.CompilerServices.Syntax.Nodes.CodeBlockNode.IsFabricated[get]
IsFabricated refers to when the ParserSession expected a node to be valid, but it wasn't.For example, a function invocation on an undefined function will construct a BoundFunctionInvocationNode with IsFabricated set to true.
